channel.title: Waiting For Review
channel.description: The show is a fortnightly catch up between David Gary Wood, and Daniel Jilg! David is the longtime host of the show, an iOS development coach based in Wellington, New Zealand. His side project applications include GoVJ (https://govjapp.com), and he is currently working on several small projects. Daniel is an establish independent developer based in the south of Germany. He is the founder of: Telemetry Deck (https://telemetrydeck.com), "Lightweight Analytics That's Not Evil", an analytics service for apps that provides speedy and accurate analytics whilst keeping user's data private and anonymised.
channel.itunes:subtitle: A fortnightly show between two iOS indie developers, David Gary Wood and Daniel Jilg
channel.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
channel.itunes:summary: The show is a fortnightly catch up between David Gary Wood, and Daniel Jilg! David is the longtime host of the show, an iOS development coach based in Wellington, New Zealand. He is the founder of: Telemetry Deck (https://telemetrydeck.com), "Lightweight Analytics That's Not Evil", an analytics service for apps that provides speedy and accurate analytics whilst keeping user's data private and anonymised.
channel.itunes:keywords: iOS development, app development, swift, Xcode, iOS dev, indie, indie dev, independent iOS development, apps, app,development,indie,iOS

item.title: S5E10: Always blow on the Pi! ü•ß
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel is getting eaten by dev-ops, and Dave is playing with the Raspberry Pi 5...
item.description: Join us, while we're Waiting For Review, This week we talk about: * Devops is eating Daniel's life * The murderbot tv show * Whale watching... * Dave is on a week off - trying to get HDMI input working on a Raspberry Pi 5. * Aliexpress nerd snipery * Brainstorming ideas for Server side swift conf * Dave is making small app to help with live performance, using GoVJ‚Äôs ‚Äúlego bricks‚Äù And of course, WWDC is coming up... -- We are open for sponsorship! email us at contact@waitingforreview.com (mailto:contact@waitingforreview.com) The Discord server is open to all, and you can contact us via our social links below. Enjoy the show, Daniel üöÄ and Dave ‚ú® Show Notes: * Dave's obscure title reference: https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-celebrate-cops-always-blow-on-the-pie-viral-videos-10-year-anniversary/354VUGOG7EBDLBYFJBDGKK2REU/ * Beluga Plane - https://social.telemetrydeck.com/@daniel/114596717002023938 * The Murderbot Diaries https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TheMurderbotDiaries * Server side swift https://www.serversideswift.info * Daniel links a cringy vid - https://www.tiktok.com/@telemetrydeck/video/7507195124670090518 * SDW blog post about iOS redesign ‚Äî https://www.lux.camera/physicality-the-new-age-of-ui/ Our Links: * IndieDev Discord Invite - https://discord.gg/bh75uGpEzQ * Youtube - https://www.youtube.com/@WaitingForReview * Website with our entire audio back catalogue - https://www.waitingforreview.com * TelemetryDeck - https://telemetrydeck.com/?source=wfr * GoVJ - https://govjapp.com * Email us! contact@waitingforreview.com (mailto:contact@waitingforreview.com) Social Media: * Dave on Mastodon - https://mastodon.social/@davelightbeam * Daniel on Mastodon - https://social.telemetrydeck.com/@daniel * WFR on Mastodon - https://iosdev.space/@waitingforreview * Dave on BlueSky - https://bsky.app/profile/davelightbeam * Daniel on BlueSky - https://bsky.app/profile/breakth-esystem.bsky.social * Dave on Instagram - https://instagram.com/lightbeamappsdotcom
item.content:encoded:
Join us, while we're Waiting For Review,

This week we talk about:

  • Devops is eating Daniel's life
  • The murderbot tv show
  • Whale watching...
  • Dave is on a week off - trying to get HDMI input working on a Raspberry Pi 5.
  • Aliexpress nerd snipery
  • Brainstorming ideas for Server side swift conf
  • Dave is making small app to help with live performance, using GoVJ‚Äôs ‚Äúlego bricks‚Äù

And of course, WWDC is coming up...

--
We are open for sponsorship! email us at contact@waitingforreview.com

The Discord server is open to all, and you can contact us via our social links below.

Enjoy the show,

Daniel üöÄ and Dave ‚ú®

Show Notes:

  • Dave's obscure title reference: https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-celebrate-cops-always-blow-on-the-pie-viral-videos-10-year-anniversary/354VUGOG7EBDLBYFJBDGKK2REU/
  • Beluga Plane - https://social.telemetrydeck.com/@daniel/114596717002023938
  • The Murderbot Diaries https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Murderbot_Diaries
  • Server side swift https://www.serversideswift.info
  • Daniel links a cringy vid - https://www.tiktok.com/@telemetrydeck/video/7507195124670090518
  • SDW blog post about iOS redesign ‚Äî https://www.lux.camera/physicality-the-new-age-of-ui/

Our Links:

  • IndieDev Discord Invite - https://discord.gg/bh75uGpEzQ

item.title: S5E9: - Vo2 To The MAX! üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel has been to GITEX, and Dave is falling into KMP/CMP after his love affair with QT was fabulously short
item.description: Join us, while we're Waiting For Review, This week we talk about: Daniel at GITEX Dave has gone straight back to KMP/CMP KotlinConf, Dave saw some bits that look nice Daniel mentions a new app that measures VO2 max and his plans to test it Dave got video mixing (see a clip on Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/reel/DKCP5Mjz0O3/?igsh=cGc3NDR2aThyZGFy)) -- We are open for sponsorship! email us at contact@waitingforreview.com (mailto:contact@waitingforreview.com) The Discord server is open to all, and you can contact us via our social links below. Enjoy the show, Dave ‚ú® und Daniel üöÄ Show Notes: * Daniel at GitEx - https://www.tiktok.com/@telemetrydeck/video/7507195124670090518 Our Links: * IndieDev Discord Invite - https://discord.gg/bh75uGpEzQ * Youtube - https://www.youtube.com/@WaitingForReview * Website with our entire audio back catalogue - https://www.waitingforreview.com * TelemetryDeck - https://telemetrydeck.com/?source=wfr * GoVJ - https://govjapp.com * Email us! contact@waitingforreview.com (mailto:contact@waitingforreview.com) Social Media: * Dave on Mastodon - https://mastodon.social/@davelightbeam * Daniel on Mastodon - https://social.telemetrydeck.com/@daniel * WFR on Mastodon - https://iosdev.space/@waitingforreview * Dave on BlueSky - https://bsky.app/profile/davelightbeam * Daniel on BlueSky - https://bsky.app/profile/breakth-esystem.bsky.social * Dave on Instagram - https://instagram.com/lightbeamappsdotcom

Join us, while we're Waiting For Review,

This week we talk about:

  • Daniel at GITEX
  • Dave has gone straight back to KMP/CMP
  • KotlinConf, Dave saw some bits that look nice
  • Daniel mentions a new app that measures VO2 max and his plans to test it
  • Dave got video mixing (see a clip on Instagram)

Join us, while we're Waiting For Review,

This week we talk about:

  • Daniel sponsors a small podcast via Patreon
  • Daniel's deep dive into Druid performance üßô‚Äç
  • Community involvement is crucial for indie developers
  • Dave has shipped some updates after a few months
  • Dave is going off the deep end with QT and cross platform development

--

item.description: Apologies for the hiatus! Dave needed some time off to recover from burnout, and these episodes remained in the can. Thanks for Waiting for us üôå -- Join us, while we're Waiting For Review, This week we talk about: - Daniel is moving to Hamburg next week ü´® - Daniel has had a professional photo shoot to update his personal branding üíÖ - Dave is transitioning to Linux for his development work, awaiting a new laptop üíª - Backward compatibility complicaitons - Deep dives into TelemetryDeck's query execution -- We are open for sponsorship! email us at contact@waitingforreview.com The Discord server is open to all, and you can contact us via our social links below. Apologies for the hiatus! Dave needed some time off to recover from burnout, and these episodes remained in the can. Thanks for Waiting for us üôå

--
Join us, while we're Waiting For Review,

This week we talk about:

  • Daniel is moving to Hamburg next week ü´®
  • Daniel has had a professional photo shoot to update his personal branding üíÖ
  • Dave is transitioning to Linux for his development work, awaiting a new laptop üíª
  • Backward compatibility complicaitons
  • Deep dives into TelemetryDeck's query execution

--
We are open for sponsorship! email us at contact@waitingforreview.com

Apologies for the hiatus! Dave needed some time off to recover from burnout, and these episodes remained in the can. Thanks for Waiting for us üôå

--
Join us, while we're Waiting For Review,

This week we talk about:

  • Daniel shares his exciting news about moving from Augsburg to Hamburg! (He is packing and downsizing!)
  • Dave's recent trip to Melbourne, where he met team members and explored the city.
  • The complexities of data management, thorny data issues and database scaling
  • Dave's transition to Linux development
  • Dave's ambitious plans to create cross-platform applications and dedicated video hardware
  • The increasingly pressing issue of data privacy, including the implications of weakened encryption and exploring alternatives for secure data management, including self-hosting and using services like Signal and Jotacloud

--

item.description: Daniel and Dave are back after a bit of a break, catching up on life‚Äîhome renovations, gardening, and even picking up new languages. They swap stories about go-karting, and the never-ending battle with to-do lists. Then, it's onto the fun stuff: new tech, indie dev, and Kotlin Multiplatform. They also get into digital freedom, alternatives to mainstream audiobook services, and the joy of diving into new hobbies. Join us, while we're Waiting For Review, -- We are open for sponsorship! email us at contact@waitingforreview.com The Discord server is open to all, and you can contact us via our social links below. Enjoy the show, Dave ‚ú®und Daniel üöÄ Show Notes: - Things and GTD Organisation - Breaking things out of Audible - https://openaudible.org - https://github.com/TortugaPower/BookPlayer - https://calibre-ebook.com - https://libbyapp.com - Dave is going down the Linux rabbit hole‚Ä¶. - https://mini-rack.jeffgeerling.com - https://github.com/jazwa/rackstack Our Links: * IndieDev Discord Invite - https://discord.gg/bh75uGpEzQ * Youtube - https://www.youtube.com/@WaitingForReview * Website with our entire audio back catalogue - https://www.waitingforreview.com * TelemetryDeck - https://telemetrydeck.com/?source=wfr * GoVJ - https://govjapp.com * Email us! contact@waitingforreview.com Social Media: * Dave on Mastodon - https://social.lightbeamapps.com/@dave * Daniel on Mastodon - https://social.telemetrydeck.com/@daniel * WFR on Mastodon - https://iosdev.space/@waitingforreview * Dave on BlueSky - https://bsky.app/profile/davelightbeam * Daniel on BlueSky - https://bsky.app/profile/breakth-esystem.bsky.social * Dave on Instagram - https://instagram.com/lightbeamappsdotcom Special Guests: Mimi, Momo, and Stevie Bobbins.

  • What did we get for Christmas?
    • Dave - a DIY NAS, a PC and a Mac mini in a pear tree
    • Daniel - a porsche taycan
  • Dave's GoVJ iOS 16 bug fix / rebuild
  • Lisa knows üòÆ

Join us, while we're Waiting For Review,

--
We are open for sponsorship! email us at contact@waitingforreview.com

Enjoy the show,

Dave ‚ú®und Daniel üöÄ

item.description: This week we talk about: The duality of Apple. One side being the beloved tech and development environment, and the other exhibiting almost mafia-like behavior re: revenue Exploring alternative platforms like Flutter Creating short-form videos on platforms like Instagram and TikTok to reach a wider audience. Daniel has a new feature for Telemetry Deck that allows users to edit queries with a user-friendly interface Super-secret-after-show-bit-that-nobody-will-know-because-they-don't-read-show-notes! This week we talk about:

  • The duality of Apple. One side being the beloved tech and development environment, and the other exhibiting almost mafia-like behavior re: revenue
  • Exploring alternative platforms like Flutter
  • Creating short-form videos on platforms like Instagram and TikTok to reach a wider audience.
  • Daniel has a new feature for Telemetry Deck that allows users to edit queries with a user-friendly interface
  • Super-secret-after-show-bit-that-nobody-will-know-because-they-don't-read-show-notes!

  • Dave is engaging marketing mode and Daniel is keeping him accountable

item.content:encoded:
This week:

  • Daniel reveals that he has purchased a Synology DiskStation, making him a 'professional podcaster' !
  • Dave has video streaming working in his apps, using the NewTek NDI SDK, allowing for low-latency transmission of video between devices!
    • We talk about supporting older devices, and the balance of that against SwiftUI versions
  • Daniel wraps the show, getting into TelemetryDeck's new permissions and roles stack

Join us, while we're Waiting For Review,

item.content:encoded:
We're trying something new, and if you want to watch us, you can check out this episode on Youtube, here

We discuss and answer a question from listener Queen Olivia St Redfern:

_" I‚Äôve worked in enterprise for the last decade, and when I‚Äôm working on my projects I‚Äôm never sure where the line is. TDD, pipelines, i18n, design systems, Fastlane automation, (to name a few) are part and parcel of an enterprise app, but is overkill for an indi dev? Where do I draw the line?"
_

We call back to a previous episodes and establish an important fact: Dave was right about Jurassic Park!

And of course, we talk about the Vision Pro...

Join us, while we're Waiting For Review,

item.content:encoded:
In our pre-Christmas holiday mode:

  • Daniel has been playing Kerbal Space Program 2
  • Dave has been making a landing page for GoVJ Pro

Meanwhile...

  • Dave has been adding nodes to his video engine
  • Daniel refocusing on sales rather than dev, trying to split his time, and when he's been coding he's trying to focus on features that will bring new business.

We also talk coding styles, and may manage to upset both TDD advocates and co-pilot fanatics üòÖ

Join us, while we're Waiting For Review,

item.title: S3E33: Lego Apps üß±
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle:
Dave is applying a modular approach, and breaking out common components in his apps into Swift Packages, a process he's describing as "Lego Apps".
Daniel is hard at work on the TelemetryDeck's web sdk ‚öíÔ∏è and has started to advertise TelemetryDeck in places you may have seen üëÄ
item.description: Dave is applying a modular approach, and breaking out common components in his apps into Swift Packages, a process he's describing as "Lego Apps". This is laying down some groundwork, for him to create a suite of related video orientated apps! Daniel is hard at work on the TelemetryDeck's web sdk ‚öíÔ∏è and has started to advertise TelemetryDeck in places you may have seen, such as the Swift Package Index and Hacking With Swift. item.content:encoded:
Dave is applying a modular approach, and breaking out common components in his apps into Swift Packages, a process he's describing as "Lego Apps". This is laying down some groundwork, for him to create a suite of related video orientated apps!

Daniel is hard at work on the TelemetryDeck's web sdk ‚öíÔ∏è and has started to advertise TelemetryDeck in places you may have seen, such as the Swift Package Index and Hacking With Swift.

Drop us a review over on Apple Podcasts at: https://podcasts.apple.com/tc/podcast/waiting-for-review/id1199635981 üôè

item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Reddit implosion (Goodbye Apollo üò¢), Dave has shipped GoVJ's MIDI feature at long last... but had an issue with his CloudKit based remote config ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
item.description: Reddit imploded in June, and we took a while to talk about the impact of this the protests, and the movement to open linksharing platforms ü§Ø Dave is building in public with GoVJ's MIDI feature, and has finally shipped! üöÄ Dave's CloudKit based remote config has let him down üò± Enjoy the show, Daniel üöÄ and Dave ‚ú® Show Notes FeedbackBulb (https://feedbackbulb.com/wfr) Lemmy (https://join-lemmy.org) kbin (https://kbin.pub) Our Links Waiting For Review (https://www.waitingforreview.com) TelemetryDeck (https://telemetrydeck.com/?source=wfr) GoVJ (https://govjapp.com) Social Media Fediverse: WFR on Mastodon (https://mstdn.social/@waitingforreview) Dave on Mastodon (https://social.davidgarywood.com/@davidgarywood) Daniel on Mastodon (https://social.telemetrydeck.com/@daniel) Twitter: WFRPodcast (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) Daniel on Twitter (https://twitter.com/breakthesystem)
item.content:encoded:
• Reddit imploded in June, and we took a while to talk about the impact of this the protests, and the movement to open linksharing platforms ü§Ø
  • Dave is building in public with GoVJ's MIDI feature, and has finally shipped! üöÄ
  • Dave's CloudKit based remote config has let him down üò±

Enjoy the show,

Daniel üöÄ and Dave ‚ú®

item.title: S3E30: The Tock after the Tick! üí°
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: We discuss the aftermath of WWDC, the Vision Pro (of course), telepresence in video calls via personas, and app tracking transparency. This episode is proudly sponsored by FeedbackBulb.com
item.description: This is our first ever sponsored show! We would like to thank Konstantin Kostov of FeedbackBulb for sponsoring the show üî• FeedbackBulb (https://feedbackbulb.com/wfr) is a one-stop shop for all your app's feedback, combining direct feedback from your app or website, with App Store Reviews and even Mastodon + Fediverse integration. Visit FeedbackBulb.com (https://feedbackbulb.com/wfr) to get started with illuminating your customer's feedback today. We discuss the aftermath of WWDC.,The Vision Pro (of course), telepresence in videocalls via personas, and App tracking transparency. Dave is an AI skeptic, but an auto-complete realist... Enjoy the show, Daniel üöÄ and Dave ‚ú® Show Notes FeedbackBulb (https://feedbackbulb.com/wfr) Our Links Waiting For Review (https://www.waitingforreview.com) TelemetryDeck (https://telemetrydeck.com/?source=wfr) TootSDK (https://github.com/tootsdk/tootsdk) Social Media Fediverse: WFR on Mastodon (https://iosdev.space/@waitingforreview) Dave on Mastodon (https://social.lightbeamapps.com/@dave) Daniel on Mastodon (https://social.telemetrydeck.com/@daniel) Twitter: WFRPodcast (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) Daniel on Twitter (https://twitter.com/breakthesystem)
item.content:encoded:
This is our first ever sponsored show! We would like to thank Konstantin Kostov of FeedbackBulb for sponsoring the show üî•

FeedbackBulb is a one-stop shop for all your app's feedback, combining direct feedback from your app or website, with App Store Reviews and even Mastodon + Fediverse integration. Visit FeedbackBulb.com to get started with illuminating your customer's feedback today.

We discuss the aftermath of WWDC.,The Vision Pro (of course), telepresence in videocalls via personas, and App tracking transparency. Dave is an AI skeptic, but an auto-complete realist...

Enjoy the show,

Daniel üöÄ and Dave ‚ú®

item.title: S3E28: It's been 8 years... why now!? üéπ ‚ö°Ô∏è
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle:
Dave is creating a Swift Package for mapping MIDI control signals and events, to blocks of application code... "TriggerKit".
We get deep and meaningful on federated and open social media, and what it would be to be able to just speak to anyone no matter what platform they use.
item.description: It's Eurovision season, and both Dave and Daniel are huge fans of the whole event! ü™©‚ú® Dave is creating a Swift Package for mapping MIDI control signals and events, to blocks of application code... "TriggerKit" which by the time this episode is live, will be open sourced and available for everyone. Daniel has been flying around BlueSky, and exploring what it has to offer. Dave gets deep and meaningful on his hopes for unification across the federated social media landscape, whatever platform you happen to use. Daniel is preparing for a presentation in Amsterdam, with a presentation you'll just have to be there for! Enjoy the show, Daniel üöÄ and Dave ‚ú® Show Notes AppDevCon Amsterdam (https://appdevcon.nl) TriggerKit (https://github.com/lightbeamapps/TriggerKit") Our Links Waiting For Review (https://www.waitingforreview.com) TelemetryDeck (https://telemetrydeck.com/?source=wfr) TootSDK (https://github.com/tootsdk/tootsdk) Topiary (https://lightbeamapps.com/topiary) Social Media Fediverse: WFR on Mastodon (https://iosdev.space/@waitingforreview) Dave on Mastodon (https://social.lightbeamapps.com/@dave) Daniel on Mastodon (https://social.telemetrydeck.com/@daniel) Twitter: WFRPodcast (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) Daniel on Twitter (https://twitter.com/breakthesystem)
item.content:encoded:
It's Eurovision season, and both Dave and Daniel are huge fans of the whole event! ü™©‚ú®

Dave is creating a Swift Package for mapping MIDI control signals and events, to blocks of application code... "TriggerKit" which by the time this episode is live, will be open sourced and available for everyone.

Daniel has been flying around BlueSky, and exploring what it has to offer. Dave gets deep and meaningful on his hopes for unification across the federated social media landscape, whatever platform you happen to use.

Daniel is preparing for a presentation in Amsterdam, with a presentation you'll just have to be there for!

Enjoy the show,

Daniel üöÄ and Dave ‚ú®

item.title: S3E24: The Superhero Maker Show ü¶∏‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: ChatGPT has made an entire backstory, podcast, and persona for Dave. David Gary Wood is a self-help Guru, podcaster, and author, who has written the book "Get Re-Inspired: Embrace your inner superhero". Meanwhile Daniel has been building funnels üì£ for TelemetryDeck!
item.description: ChatGPT has made an entire backstory, podcast, and persona for Dave. David Gary Wood is a self-help Guru, podcaster, and author, who has written the book "Get Re-Inspired: Embrace your inner superhero"... None of this is true, but that hasn't stopped the wayward API from leaning into the mythology and inventing an entire theme song for David and his new podcast. Meanwhile Daniel has been building funnels üì£ for TelemetryDeck. This will enable app developers to see the sequence in which events occur, and to understand their customers even better! Enjoy the show, Dave ‚ú® und Daniel üöÄ Our Links ChatGPT making up David's backstory (https://social.davidgarywood.com/@davidgarywood/109882656573131102) TelemetryDeck filters and calculation infrastructure (https://telemetrydeck.com/blog/update-v2023-2) TootSDK (https://github.com/tootsdk/tootsdk) Waiting For Review (https://www.waitingforreview.com) TelemetryDeck (https://telemetrydeck.com/?source=wfr) GoVJ in the AppStore (https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/govj/id1028844660?mt=8&at=1001lu3w) Social Media Fediverse: WFR on Mastodon (https://iosdev.space/@waitingforreview) Dave on Mastodon (https://social.lightbeamapps.com/@dave) Daniel on Mastodon (https://social.telemetrydeck.com/@daniel) Twitter: WFRPodcast (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) Daniel on Twitter (https://twitter.com/breakthesystem)
item.content:encoded:
ChatGPT has made an entire backstory, podcast, and persona for Dave. David Gary Wood is a self-help Guru, podcaster, and author, who has written the book "Get Re-Inspired: Embrace your inner superhero"... None of this is true, but that hasn't stopped the wayward API from leaning into the mythology and inventing an entire theme song for David and his new podcast.

Meanwhile Daniel has been building funnels üì£ for TelemetryDeck. This will enable app developers to see the sequence in which events occur, and to understand their customers even better!

Enjoy the show,

Dave ‚ú® und Daniel üöÄ

item.title: S3E19: It's not actually that big...üôä
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Dave has become a 2-app indie developer again, with the release of his newest app, Video to Audio. TootSDK is nearly ready for release, and Daniel has been hard at work with TelemetryDeck on data intersection, which will let him bring features like funnels to the product üéâ
item.description: In this episode... Dave has become a 2-app indie developer again, with the release of his newest app "Video to Audio" (https://lightbeamapps.com/videotoaudio). Dave's descent into the Fediverse has also progressed further as he prepares to release TootSDK with his fellow maintainer, Konstantin. Daniel has been hard at work adding intersection to TelemetryDeck to support new features like funnels, and other cuts of the analytics data üéâ Daniel has also taken stock of everything that TelemetryDeck has released lately and has blogged (https://telemetrydeck.com/blog/update-v2022-12/?source=wfr) with a beautiful apple-style bento infographic to show it all off! üòé Enjoy the show, Daniel üöÄ und Dave ‚ú® Links from the show Astro, ASO tool (https://asoproject.carrd.co/?utm_source=WFR) Dave's app, Video to Audio (https://lightbeamapps.com/videotoaudio) TootSDK on github (https://github.com/tootsdk/tootsdk) TootSDK on Mastodon (https://iosdev.space/@tootsdk) Daniel's blog post (https://telemetrydeck.com/blog/update-v2022-12/?source=wfr) Telemetry Viewer (https://github.com/TelemetryDeck/TelemetryViewer) Our Links Waiting For Review (https://www.waitingforreview.com) TelemetryDeck (https://telemetrydeck.com/?source=wfr) GoVJ in the AppStore (https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/govj/id1028844660?mt=8&at=1001lu3w) Social Media Fediverse: WFR on Mastodon (https://iosdev.space/@waitingforreview) Dave on Mastodon (https://social.lightbeamapps.com/@dave) Daniel on Mastodon (https://social.telemetrydeck.com/@daniel) Twitter: WFRPodcast (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) Daniel on Twitter (https://twitter.com/breakthesystem)
item.content:encoded:
In this episode...

Dave has become a 2-app indie developer again, with the release of his newest app "Video to Audio" .

Dave's descent into the Fediverse has also progressed further as he prepares to release TootSDK with his fellow maintainer, Konstantin.

Daniel has been hard at work adding intersection to TelemetryDeck to support new features like funnels, and other cuts of the analytics data üéâ

Daniel has also taken stock of everything that TelemetryDeck has released lately and has blogged with a beautiful apple-style bento infographic to show it all off! üòé

Enjoy the show,

Daniel üöÄ und Dave ‚ú®

item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel is moving data into his new server setup for TelemetryDeck and writing blog posts on iOS 16 market share, Dave is making a Mastodon SDK and preparing his new app for release
item.description: Daniel updates on: * Is moving data from his old server to his new one for TelemetryDeck. * Putting together his "Orbital Survey" blog post for iOS 16 market share, leading him to play with Blender for an image too Meanwhile, Dave has been: * Working on a new Swift SDK for Mastodon/Fediverse with Konstantin Kostov: TootSDK. * Preparing his app VITA (Video to Audio) for release * Configuring his personal Mastodon instance And Daniel swerved getting an Xbox, and steered straight into renting a PS5 for Gran Tourismo goodness! üèÅ Enjoy the show, Dave ‚ú® and Daniel üöÄ Our Links: TelemetryDeck iOS 16 blog post (https://telemetrydeck.com/blog/ios16-market-share/?source=wfr) TelemetryDeck (https://telemetrydeck.com/?source=wfr) Waiting For Review (https://www.waitingforreview.com) GoVJ in the AppStore (https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/govj/id1028844660?mt=8&at=1001lu3w) Social Media Fediverse: WFR on Mastodon (https://iosdev.space/@waitingforreview) Dave on Mastodon (https://social.lightbeamapps.com/@dave) Daniel on Mastodon (https://social.telemetrydeck.com/@daniel) Twitter: WFRPodcast (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) Daniel on Twitter (https://twitter.com/breakthesystem) Dave on Twitter (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) GoVJ on Twitter (https://twitter.com/govjapp)
item.content:encoded:
Daniel updates on:

  • Is moving data from his old server to his new one for TelemetryDeck.
  • Putting together his "Orbital Survey" blog post for iOS 16 market share, leading him to play with Blender for an image too

Meanwhile, Dave has been:

  • Working on a new Swift SDK for Mastodon/Fediverse with Konstantin Kostov: TootSDK.
  • Preparing his app VITA (Video to Audio) for release
  • Configuring his personal Mastodon instance

And Daniel swerved getting an Xbox, and steered straight into renting a PS5 for Gran Tourismo goodness! üèÅ

Enjoy the show,

Dave ‚ú® and Daniel üöÄ

Our Links:

  • TelemetryDeck iOS 16 blog post
  • TelemetryDeck
  • Waiting For Review
  • GoVJ in the AppStore

Daniel has open sourced TelemetryDeck's Swift apps, as his development time is focusing primarily on TelemetryDeck's web application.

Dave talks a little about his new day-job,paywalls and his balance of pricing for GoVJ subscriptions, and has been spending some time on another side project app (VITA: Video to Audio, thank you Kris!).

Enjoy the show,

item.title: S3E12: I've experienced carousal üé†
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: A lower baseline of sales starts to form for Dave for GoVJ, meanwhile Daniel is now employed by Telemetry Deck as his company reaches it's next stage
item.description: Dave loses his extra sales for GoVJ 2.0, as a lower baseline starts to form post launch. Dave has diverted himself into exploring Vapor (Swift on the Server), for a test project... Daniel prepares the wagging finger to remind Dave to get marketing. Daniel is now employed by Telemetry Deck, as his company reaches it's next stage. As a good employee, he's setting up automated tests in github actions and cranking on. Enjoy the show, Dave ‚ú® and Daniel üöÄ Links: * govjapp.com (https://govjapp.com) * Go VJ in the AppStore (https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/govj/id1028844660?mt=8&at=1001lu3w) * TelemetryDeck (https://telemetrydeck.com/?source=wfr) * Waiting For Review (https://www.waitingforreview.com) Social Media Twitter: * Dave on Twitter (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) * GoVJ on Twitter (https://twitter.com/govjapp) * WFRPodcast (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) * Daniel on Twitter (https://twitter.com/breakthesystem) Fediverse: * Daniel on Mastodon (https://mstdn.io/@breakthesystem) * Dave on Mastodon/Fediverse (https://social.davidgarywood.com/davidgarywood)
item.content:encoded:
Dave loses his extra sales for GoVJ 2.0, as a lower baseline starts to form post launch. Dave has diverted himself into exploring Vapor (Swift on the Server), for a test project... Daniel prepares the wagging finger to remind Dave to get marketing.

Daniel is now employed by Telemetry Deck, as his company reaches it's next stage. As a good employee, he's setting up automated tests in github actions and cranking on.

Enjoy the show,

Dave ‚ú® and Daniel üöÄ

item.title: S3E6: To test, or not to test? ‚úÖ
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle:
Daniel quizzes Dave on how he approaches automated testing in his day-job vs his solo indie app endeavours.
How much is too much for a solo developer? What's a good depth of testing for different sizes of project and team?
item.description: We catch up on Daniel's ProductHunt debut of TelemetryDeck (https://telemetrydeck.com/?source=wfr). Dave inches closer to releasing GoVJ 2 as he uses some time off from his day-job to bug-fix, and clean things up. We discuss automated testing. Daniel quizzes Dave on how he approaches automated testing in his day-job vs his solo indie app endeavours. How much is too much for a solo developer? What's a good depth of testing for different sizes of project and team? Enjoy the show, Dave ‚ú® and Daniel üöÄ If you're interested in checking GoVJ 2 out, WFR users can use this public link: TestFlight (https://testflight.apple.com/join/cnOKvnBG) Links: * Daniel's blog post on screenshot testing (https://blog.winsmith.de/english/ios/2020/04/14/xcuitest-screenshots.html) * TelemetryDeck on ProductHunt (https://www.producthunt.com/posts/telemetrydeck) * TelemetryDeck (https://telemetrydeck.com/?source=wfr) * Waiting For Review (https://www.waitingforreview.com) * davidgarywood.com (https://davidgarywood.com) Twitter * David Gary Wood on Twitter (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) * Daniel Jilg on Twitter (https://twitter.com/breakthesystem) * WFRPodcast (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) Special Guests: Mimi, Momo, and Monty.

item.content:encoded:
We catch up on Daniel's ProductHunt debut of TelemetryDeck.

Dave inches closer to releasing GoVJ 2 as he uses some time off from his day-job to bug-fix, and clean things up.

We discuss automated testing. Daniel quizzes Dave on how he approaches automated testing in his day-job vs his solo indie app endeavours.

How much is too much for a solo developer? What's a good depth of testing for different sizes of project and team?

Enjoy the show,

Dave ‚ú® and Daniel üöÄ

item.title: S3E4: Just keep shipping üõ≥
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Dave has hit a mental block with "Project Magnum", with a lagging ARView... Meanwhile, Daniel has been super productive improving performance in TelemetryDeck
item.description: Dave has hit a mental block with "Project Magnum", with a lagging ARView, and may be focusing on his app GoVJ 2 in the meantime. Daniel has created a queuing system for his server-side Swift backend for TelemetryDeck, that enables him to give much better performance to his users. We hit on how slicing features into smaller chunks to ship can give our users more, instead of waiting for things to be "perfect" ! Enjoy the show, David ‚ú® and Daniel üöÄ Links: * Daniel Jilg on Twitter (https://twitter.com/breakthesystem) * Telemetry (https://telemetrydeck.com) * David Gary Wood on Twitter (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) * davidgarywood.com (https://davidgarywood.com) * Waiting For Review (https://www.waitingforreview.com)
item.content:encoded:
Dave has hit a mental block with "Project Magnum", with a lagging ARView, and may be focusing on his app GoVJ 2 in the meantime.

Daniel has created a queuing system for his server-side Swift backend for TelemetryDeck, that enables him to give much better performance to his users.

We hit on how slicing features into smaller chunks to ship can give our users more, instead of waiting for things to be "perfect" !

Enjoy the show,

David ‚ú® and Daniel üöÄ

item.title: S3E1: WFR Reboot! üöÄ
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Join David Gary Wood, and new co-host, Daniel Jilg! We catch up about our development lives, Daniel's recent time split on marketing, and Dave's thoughts around Augmented Reality
item.description: The rebooted Waiting For Review has arrived with Season 3! üí• The show is a fortnightly catch up between David Gary Wood, and new co-host, Daniel Jilg! David is the longtime host of the show, an iOS development coach based in Wellington, New Zealand. His side project applications include GoVJ (https://govjapp.com), and he is currently working on several small projects and a top-secret video orientated one. Daniel is an establish independent developer based in the south of Germany. He is the founder of: Telemetry Deck (https://telemetrydeck.com), "Lightweight Analytics That's Not Evil", an analytics service for apps that provides speedy and accurate analytics whilst keeping user's data private and anonymised. Join us as we catch up about our development lives, Daniel's recent time split on marketing, and Dave's thoughts around Augmented Reality. We hope you enjoy the show, David ‚ú® and Daniel üöÄ Links: * Daniel Jilg on Twitter (https://twitter.com/breakthesystem) * David Gary Wood on Twitter (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) * Telemetry (https://telemetrydeck.com) * davidgarywood.com (https://davidgarywood.com) * Waiting For Review (https://www.waitingforreview.com) Special Guests: Mimi, Momo, and Monty.
item.content:encoded:
The rebooted Waiting For Review has arrived with Season 3! üí•

The show is a fortnightly catch up between David Gary Wood, and new co-host, Daniel Jilg!

David is the longtime host of the show, an iOS development coach based in Wellington, New Zealand. His side project applications include GoVJ, and he is currently working on several small projects and a top-secret video orientated one.

Daniel is an establish independent developer based in the south of Germany. He is the founder of: Telemetry Deck, "Lightweight Analytics That's Not Evil", an analytics service for apps that provides speedy and accurate analytics whilst keeping user's data private and anonymised.

Join us as we catch up about our development lives, Daniel's recent time split on marketing, and Dave's thoughts around Augmented Reality.

We hope you enjoy the show,

David ‚ú® and Daniel üöÄ

item.title: S2E15: Daryl Baxter
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Daryl Baxter joins me on the show to talk about what makes for a good approach for indie developers when reaching out to the press, M1 MacBook Pros, and his new book: The Making Of Tomb Raider!
item.description: A returning guest of the show, the one and only Daryl Baxter joins me on the show. Daryl is a tech writer, specialising in apps, apple and retro gaming. Daryl joins me on the show to talk about what makes for a good approach for indie developers when reaching out to the press, M1 Macbook Pros, and his new book: The Making Of Tomb Raider. Enjoy the show, David ‚ú® Links: * The Making Of Tomb Raider (https://www.pen-and-sword.co.uk/The-Making-of-Tomb-Raider-Hardback/p/20165) * Daryl @ Tech Radar (https://www.techradar.com/uk/author/daryl-baxter) * Daryl Baxter on Twitter (https://twitter.com/darylbaxter) * David Gary Wood on Twitter (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) * Waiting For Review (https://www.waitingforreview.com) Special Guest: Daryl Baxter.
item.content:encoded:
A returning guest of the show, the one and only Daryl Baxter joins me on the show. Daryl is a tech writer, specialising in apps, apple and retro gaming.

Daryl joins me on the show to talk about what makes for a good approach for indie developers when reaching out to the press, M1 Macbook Pros, and his new book: The Making Of Tomb Raider.

Enjoy the show,

David ‚ú®

item.title: S2E13: Austin Blake - MityNote, 2196
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Austin is a prolific indie developer from Salt Lake City in the US. He creates beautiful apps in the productivity niche. We talk subscriptions, marketing, and subscriptions.
item.description: I‚Äôm joined by Austin Blake, a prolific indie developer from Salt Lake City in the US. He creates beautiful apps in the productivity niche. His note taking app Mitynote has just hit it's 3.0. release. We talked about his development, marketing, and release process, and how that's honed over time and the years. Austin has a grounded view of making his apps accessible for everyone, whilst monetizing and supporting his work through subscriptions. Enjoy the show! item.title: S2E11 - David Niemeijer, AssistiveWare
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: AssistiveWare make Augmentative and Alternative Communication (AAC) apps, that help many people communicate better in their lives. AssistiveWare have a long history of Apple applications and iOS. Founder David Niemeijer joins me to tell me more about what they do. We talk product development, market fit, pricing, and about his company's broader mission.
item.description: I‚Äôm joined by David Niemeijer, founder and CEO of AssistiveWare. AssistiveWare make Augmentative and Alternative Communication (AAC) apps, that help many people communicate better in their lives. AssistiveWare have a long history of Apple applications and iOS, and so I thought I‚Äôd get him on the show to talk more about how they started and what they do. We talk product development, market fit, and the counter intuitive aspect of pricing that enables both sustainability of the product and the ability to reach users that benefit. David ‚ú® Links: * https://www.assistiveware.com (https://www.assistiveware.com) * https://www.assistiveware.com/products/proloquo2go (https://www.assistiveware.com/products/proloquo2go) * David Niemeijer on Twitter (https://twitter.com/niemeijerd) * David Gary Wood on Twitter (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) * Waiting For Review on Twitter (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) * waitingforview.com (https://www.waitingforreview.com) Special Guest: David Niemeijer.

item.title: S2E9 - Chris Hefferman - LoTR Quiz, MyAdsense, Fireside Swift
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Chris is the iOS developer behind LoTR Quiz, and MyAdsense. Since launching his apps in the App Store, he's made the leap into iOS development full time, changing his career in the process. We talk about all of this, joining the Fireside Swift crew on their podcast, being an active member of the iOS development community!
item.description: I'm joined on this episode by Chris Hefferman. Chris is the iOS developer behind LoTR Quiz, and MyAdsense. Since launching his apps in the App Store, he's made the leap into iOS development full time, changing his career in the process. Chris talks to me about this, his background in development, joining the Fireside Swift crew on their podcast and being an active member of the iOS development community. 2021 looks set to be a big year for Chris, as he's looking for a full time iOS development position where he can really spread his wings. I hope you enjoy the show as much as I did recording it, David ‚ú® Links: * Chris Hefferman Portfolio (https://chrishefferman.squarespace.com) * Chris on Twitter (https://twitter.com/heffertron) * Fireside Swift (https://twitter.com/fireside_swift) * Fireside Swift Project (https://github.com/heffertron/share_the_load) * LoTR Quiz App (http://apps.apple.com/app/id1446587245) * MyAdsense app (https://apps.apple.com/app/id1481431267) * Chris's blog (https://chrishefferman.squarespace.com/blog-landing-page) * David Gary Wood on Twitter (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) * Waiting For Review on Twitter (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) * waitingforview.com (https://www.waitingforreview.com) Special Guest: Chris Hefferman.
item.content:encoded:
I'm joined on this episode by Chris Hefferman.

Chris is the iOS developer behind LoTR Quiz, and MyAdsense. Since launching his apps in the App Store, he's made the leap into iOS development full time, changing his career in the process.

Chris talks to me about this, his background in development, joining the Fireside Swift crew on their podcast and being an active member of the iOS development community. 2021 looks set to be a big year for Chris, as he's looking for a full time iOS development position where he can really spread his wings.

I hope you enjoy the show as much as I did recording it,

item.title: S2E8 - Josh Holtz, Fastlane & Otter RSS
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: I invited Josh on the show to tell us all about how he became the superstar he is today. We dig into his progression from first PR to becoming lead maintainer of Fastlane. We talk RSS and Otters.
item.description: I'm joined on this episode by Josh Holtz. Josh is a man of many talents. He's the lead maintainer of Fastlane tools. He co-founded a software consulting company called RokkinCat. He's the father of a brilliant boy, Hudson. He's made an Otter themed RSS app. AN OTTER THEMED APP. ü¶¶ I invited Josh on the show to tell us all about how he became the superstar he is today. We dig into his progression from first PR to becoming lead maintainer of Fastlane. We talk Otters. I hope you enjoy the show, David ‚ú® Links: * joshholtz.com (https://www.joshholtz.com) * Josh Holtz on Twitter (https://twitter.com/joshdholtz) * Otter RSS Twitter (https://twitter.com/AnOtterRSS) * David Gary Wood on Twitter (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) * Waiting For Review on Twitter (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) * waitingforview.com (https://www.waitingforreview.com) Special Guest: Josh D Holtz.

item.title: S2E7 - Bobby Bobak, Filtru
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Bobby is the developer of Filtru, a brilliant coffee timer that helps people create their perfect brew. He's a self taught developer, with an extremely sharp design eye and background. His apps are joyful to use and pop when they're on screen. We catch up about how he learnt development, and how he built and launched Filtru.
item.description: I'm joined in this episode by Bobby Bobak Bobby is the developer of Filtru, a brilliant coffee timer that helps people create their perfect brew. item.description: I'm joined in this episode by Victor Marks. Victor is a product designer, blogger, and tech industry heavy weight. You may have read some of his many articles over at AppleInsider, Knapsack.news or even Wrist Watch Reviews. He has many years in the industry, and a ton of experience in product development, marketing, launching, and app reviews. We talk about Gary's journey into iOS development, and his latest Application, Meandr. Meandr is a beautiful application for mapping your walks, and was recently featured on iMore! üöÄ

Enjoy the show,

David ‚ú®

item.title: S2E3 - Ben Guerrette, Pixite
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Ben Guerrette is the creative director of Pixite. I thought I‚Äôd catch up with him today to find out more about what makes him and the company tick, and how Pixite has adapted to changing App Store conditions over the years
item.description: I'm joined in this episode by Ben Guerrette. Ben is the Creative Director of Pixite, at Pixite, a small company that‚Äôs been flying high in the App Store for many years. Pixite have many apps in the store, ranging from creative journalling, graphic design, through to their colourful drawing and relaxation app, Pigment. Pixite have gone from strength to strength, with app revenue bootstrapping the business into life, and consistent App Store features for their products. As dynamics have changed with the App Store and revenue, Pixite have had to adapt their approach and business model for revenue. I thought I‚Äôd catch up with Ben to find out more. I hope you enjoy the show, David ‚ú® Links: * Pixite on Twitter (https://twitter.com/pixiteapps) * Ben Guerrette on Twitter (https://twitter.com/benguerrette) * David Gary Wood on Twitter (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) * Waiting For Review on Twitter (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) * https://www.pixiteapps.com * Waiting For Review (https://waitingforreview.com) * Pixite on Instagram (* https://www.instagram.com/pixiteapps/) * Ben Guerrette on Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/benguerrette/) * Ben Guerrette on Vimeo (https://vimeo.com/user2130887)

item.description: Season 2 of Waiting for Review lands with a blast! üöÄ The show is now fortnightly, as I, David Gary Wood, interview developers from the iOS indie community. I'm joined in this episode by Daniel Jilg. Daniel has a history in privacy orientated development, and developed of one of the first 100 apps in the App Store. Daniel is currently working on a brand new analytics service for iOS applications: Telemetry, a lightweight analytics service, that's "not evil". I hope you enjoy the show, David ‚ú® Links: * Daniel Jilg on Twitter (https://twitter.com/breakthesystem) * David Gary Wood on Twitter (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) * Telemetry (https://telemetrydeck.com) * Libi Tracker (https://libitracker.app) * Ghostery Privacy Browser (https://apps.apple.com/us/app/ghostery-privacy-browser/id472789016?itsct=apps_box&itscg=30200) Special Guest: Daniel Jilg.

item.title: 183: What's next for Waiting For Review?
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: What's next for Waiting For Review ... ?
item.description: Dave Nott has departed for pastures new, and I bid him farewell and a heartfelt thanks for all of the episodes we've recorded in what is now Season 1 of this podcast. In the coming weeks, Waiting For Review shall return. I'll be interviewing iOS developers from the indie development community, to find out what makes them and their apps tick. If you'd like to guest on the show, or to be invited to the WFR indie development slack community then reach out to me via twitter @davidgarywood (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood)) or email me at wfr@davidgarywood.com (wfr@davidgarywood.com). Thanks to all of our listeners for Season 1, and I hope you join me for more Waiting For Review next month! Dave Wood (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) Dave Nott (https://twitter.com/_davenott) Waiting For Review (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) Music by Broke For Free (http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Broke_For_Free/Something_EP/Broke_For_Free-Something_EP-_05_Something_Elated) License, CC Attribution 3 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/us/)

item.content:encoded:
Dave Nott has departed for pastures new, and I bid him farewell and a heartfelt thanks for all of the episodes we've recorded in what is now Season 1 of this podcast.

In the coming weeks, Waiting For Review shall return. I'll be interviewing iOS developers from the indie development community, to find out what makes them and their apps tick.

If you'd like to guest on the show, or to be invited to the WFR indie development slack community then reach out to me via twitter @davidgarywood) or email me at [wfr@davidgarywood.com](wfr@davidgarywood.com).

Thanks to all of our listeners for Season 1, and I hope you join me for more Waiting For Review next month!

item.description: The 13" MacBook Pro serves to confuse us, more so when we consider the recent MacBook Air refresh. Are these machines the last of their kind? Will this year be the year we get "the talk" from Apple at WWDC about an ARM transition? We discuss what that could look like, and how things might shake out. * Dave Nott (https://twitter.com/_davenott) Dave Wood (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) Waiting For Review (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) Music by Broke For Free (http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Broke_For_Free/Something_EP/Broke_For_Free-Something_EP-_05_Something_Elated) License, CC Attribution 3 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/us/)

The 13" MacBook Pro serves to confuse us, more so when we consider the recent MacBook Air refresh. Are these machines the last of their kind? Will this year be the year we get "the talk" from Apple at WWDC about an ARM transition?

item.title: 155: Go Back to UIKit?
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: After another week of frustration, Dave Nott begins to doubt the merits of continuing development with SwiftUI. Would it be easier to down tools and move back to the safety of UIKit to get the job finished?
item.description: After another week of frustration, Dave Nott begins to doubt the merits of continuing development with SwiftUI. Would it be easier to down tools and move back to the safety of UIKit to get the job finished? We also discuss the newly announced Mac and iOS App Bundles and go on a rant about free trials and upgrade pricing. Waiting For Review (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) Dave Wood (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) Dave Nott (https://twitter.com/_davenott) Music by Broke For Free (http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Broke_For_Free/Something_EP/Broke_For_Free-Something_EP-_05_Something_Elated) License, CC Attribution 3 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/us/)
item.content:encoded:
After another week of frustration, Dave Nott begins to doubt the merits of continuing development with SwiftUI. Would it be easier to down tools and move back to the safety of UIKit to get the job finished?

We also discuss the newly announced Mac and iOS App Bundles and go on a rant about free trials and upgrade pricing.

  • Dave Wood

item.title: 153: SwiftUI - I Have Feelings...
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Both Daves have spent the last week working with SwiftUI. Is it the right technology to choose when starting a new app? Or will we regret jumping in on the new shiny?
item.description: Both Daves have spent the last week working with SwiftUI. It's quickly becoming apparent that there are some things it simply can't do at this point. Is it the right technology to choose when starting a new app? Or will we regret jumping in on the new shiny? Meanwhile, all this cross-platform development is making Dave Nott consider a development iPad. Waiting For Review (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) Dave Wood (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) Dave Nott (https://twitter.com/_davenott) Baxter (https://darylbaxter.com) Music by Broke For Free (http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Broke_For_Free/Something_EP/Broke_For_Free-Something_EP-_05_Something_Elated) License, CC Attribution 3 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/us/)
item.content:encoded:
Both Daves have spent the last week working with SwiftUI. It's quickly becoming apparent that there are some things it simply can't do at this point. Is it the right technology to choose when starting a new app? Or will we regret jumping in on the new shiny?

Meanwhile, all this cross-platform development is making Dave Nott consider a development iPad.

  • Waiting For Review
  • Dave Wood

item.title: 139: Reading Tea Leaves
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle:
A single leaked image about the 16" and we're straight into reading the tea leaves for the new MacBook Pro. It's not quite looking like the machine Dave Nott has pined for, but the predictions are still fuzzy as we record.
Dave Nott has a wobble with his indie development plans and is second guessing which project he should pick up with the time he has.
item.description: A single leaked image about the 16" and we're straight into reading the tea leaves for the new MacBook Pro. It's not quite looking like the machine Dave Nott has pined for, but the predictions are still fuzzy as we record. Dave Nott has a wobble with his indie development plans and is second guessing which project he should pick up with the time he has. We get into approaches for getting an idea of the scale of a project, cutting scope and planning features in an order that lets shipping happen sooner. item.title: 134: Heidi and Ish - Capsicum Creators!
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: In a special episode, our guests are Heidi and Ish, creators of Capsicum App and more. We welcome them back to the show to talk about their launch experiences, the highs and lows of seeing massive public interest on day one, and where they're taking it next.
item.description: In a special episode, our guests are Heidi and Ish, creators of Capsicum App and more. Capsicum is a beautiful daily planner app, chock full of features and a unique design. Heidi and Ish were previously on the show over 2 years ago, when their app was still in it's early stages of development. We welcome them back to the show to talk about their launch experiences, the highs and lows of seeing massive public interest on day one, and where they're taking it next. Heidi Helen Pilypas (https://twitter.com/heidi_helen) Ish (https://twitter.com/ishabazz) Capsicum App (https://capsicum.app) Waiting For Review (https://twitter.com/wfrpodcast) Dave Nott (https://twitter.com/_davenott) Dave Wood (https://twitter.com/davidgarywood) Music by Broke For Free (http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Broke_For_Free/Something_EP/Broke_For_Free-Something_EP-_05_Something_Elated) - License, CC Attribution 3 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/us/) Special Guests: Heidi Helen Pilypas and Ish.

In a special episode, our guests are Heidi and Ish, creators of Capsicum App and more.

Capsicum is a beautiful daily planner app, chock full of features and a unique design. Heidi and Ish were previously on the show over 2 years ago, when their app was still in it's early stages of development.

Meanwhile we've a bit of an announcement to make. We're taking a short break across the summer (in the Northern hemisphere at least!), and will be back in a few weeks with Season 2 of the show.

Until then, you can reach us at our Slack channel, and catch up with us on Twitter. We'd like to give a huge thanks to all listeners of the show, and we'll be back with you soon!

item.title: Episode 129: Could full time indie be bad?
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Could full time indie be bad?
item.description:
We start the show with discussion of random videos online and deep fakes, before getting into the process of rebooting development on an indie app.

Dave Nott's scheduled return to indie development later this year leads us to wondering, what might an ideal indie balance be like, and might full-time, actually be a bad thing?

item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood

item.title: Episode 121: Developing AirSynth
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Dave Wood has finished development on his new app AirSynth. We discuss the finishing touches needed to send it to the App Store.
item.description:
Dave Wood has finished development on his new app AirSynth. We discuss the finishing touches needed to send it to the App Store.

Dave Nott throws a spanner in the works when discussing the payment model - has Dave got the right one?

We discuss the pro's / con's of paid up front v.s. freemium for a small novelty app, automation of App Store screenshots, and motivations for putting a small app into the store.

  • Music by Broke For Free
  • Attribution 3.0 United States (CC BY 3.0 US)

item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we discuss the Intel NUC vs the latest Mac Mini, we discuss the upcoming Mac Pro, what we might see at WWDC on the Mac hardware front and look back at old mac hardware pricing - are todays prices really that high? Finally, we discuss the...
item.description:
This week we discuss the Intel NUC vs the latest Mac Mini, we discuss the upcoming Mac Pro, what we might see at WWDC on the Mac hardware front and look back at old mac hardware pricing - are todays prices really that high? Finally, we discuss the right to repair and why a "dead motherboard" might not mean needing a new one.

  • Music by Broke For Free
  • Attribution 3.0 United States (CC BY 3.0 US)

David Wood has a new show, a short microcast called Iterate, to chronicle his indie app development. We get into what that‚Äôs all about, and how he started it off.

In industry news, we discuss Apple‚Äôs harder stance on companies using analytics technologies that spy on users, and what that can mean for app developers.

item.title: Episode 106: Episode 106: Incremental Development
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: we discuss how we're both having to take an incremental approach to our indie development right now, doing little by little when time allows.
item.description:
After reflecting on last weeks special episode with Shawn King, we discuss how we're both having to take an incremental approach to our indie development right now, doing little by little when time allows. We talk about how we keep motivated when progress can seem to be so slow and how we might adjust our schedules keep things sustainable.

item.title: Episode 105: Episode 105: With special guest Shawn King
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: We are super lucky this week to be joined by Shawn King from the podcast Your Mac Life. Shawn started podcasting about Apple nearly 25 years ago, before the word podcast was even a thing.
item.description:
We are super lucky this week to be joined by Shawn King from the podcast Your Mac Life. Shawn started podcasting about Apple nearly 25 years ago, before the word podcast was even a thing.

Having just crossed episode 1200 of Your Mac Life, we get together with Shawn and chat about how he got started, and how Apple has changed over the last 25 years.

We dig into where he sees the iPad and Mac Pro going, along with discussing his interactions with Steve Jobs and more.

Join us for Waiting For Review.

Links:

  • Your Mac Life
  • Starting Point Photography
  • Music by Broke For Free
  • Attribution 3.0 United States (CC BY 3.0 US)

¬†

item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: With us both finding free time to be in short supply, we look at ways that we can claw some time back into our days. We look at getting up earlier on a sustainable basis and examine what we consider "down time" to be.

item.title: Episode 60: Episode 60: Mac OS 11?
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood

item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we discuss different business models on the App Store, Dave Nott is considering a switch to subscription for one app and paid up front for another, while Dave Wood is considering an interesting blend of freemium and subscriptions.
item.description:

Dave Nott also gets upset about the lack of free trials (again!) and has some thoughts on the perceived value of apps‚Ä¶

item.title: Episode 10: Episode 10: iPhone Whatever / iPad SE
item.author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:author: David Gary Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Apple's latest product announcements may say a lot about where the iOS and Mac eco-system is going.
item.description:
Apple released several new products with a fairly quiet announcement. We discuss these and what they say about the apple eco-system as a whole. Dave Wood dreams about the Mac Pro Cube, and Dave Nott expresses his hopes for a greater Siri experience. Join us for an episode of Apple punditry, in Waiting for Review.
